snippet: The iPad Mini was announced Tuesday, with a retail price starting at $329. How it compares with other small tablet models currently available:

headline.main: The iPad Mini and Its Competition

snippet: Finra says it has banned David Lerner from the brokerage business for a year. The firm he founded says he'll just move over to its mutual fund operations, not regulated by Finra.
abstract: Finra says it has banned David Lerner from the brokerage business for a year. The firm he founded says he'll just move over to its mutual fund operations, not regulated by Finra.

headline.main: Poppy Thumbs His Nose at Finra. Again.

snippet: Even after the popularity of BlackBerrys among consumers went into a tailspin, it was widely assumed that their security features would keep law enforcement agencies loyal to the brand. But the decision by the Department of Homeland Security to sw...
abstract: Even after the popularity of BlackBerrys among consumers went into a tailspin, it was widely assumed that their security features would keep law enforcement agencies loyal to the brand. But the decision by the Department of Homeland Security to switch 17,676 employees to iPhones from BlackBerrys suggests even that assumption no longer holds true.

headline.main: U.S. Customs Workers to Switch to iPhones From BlackBerrys

snippet: The firm’s founder was also suspended for one year from the securities industry as part of sanctions stemming from the marketing of a $2 billion real estate investment trust.
abstract: Financial Industry Regulatory Authority orders David Lerner Associates to pay about $12 million to customers that bought into a $2 billion real estate investment trust and to those who were charged excessive markups; agency also fines firm's founder and chief executive David Lerner $250,000, suspending him from the securities industry for one year, followed by a two-year suspension from acting as a principal.

headline.main: David Lerner Associates Ordered to Pay $14 Million
headline.print_headline: David Lerner Associates Is Fined and Its Founder Is Suspended Over Customer Markups

snippet: Gary Clark Jr. has made a name for himself touring as a straight-up bluesman, but his new album, “Blak and Blu,” presents him as a pop eclectic.
abstract: Blues musician Gary Clark Jr credits his home town of Austin, Tex, for giving him the eclectic pop style exhibited on his latest album Blak and Blu.

headline.main: Always at Home, Wherever He Plays
headline.print_headline: Always at Home, Wherever He Plays

snippet: Investors awaited third-quarter growth figures from the government and for the direction that will come with the outcome of the presidential election in two weeks.
abstract: Stocks close with slim gains as investors are underwhelmed by the latest round of corporate earnings reports.

headline.main: Shares Rise Slightly As Uncertainty Prevails
headline.print_headline: Shares Rise Slightly As Uncertainty Prevails

snippet: Microsoft Windows, which has more than a billion users, is getting a radical makeover, a rare move for a product with such vast reach, Nick Wingfield reports in The New York Times. The new design is likely to cause some head-scratching when Window...
abstract: Microsoft Windows, which has more than a billion users, is getting a radical makeover, a rare move for a product with such vast reach, Nick Wingfield reports in The New York Times. The new design is likely to cause some head-scratching when Windows 8 goes on sale on Friday.

headline.main: Daily Report: Windows Makeover May Cause Head-Scratching

snippet: Robert Griffin III put on his cape late in the fourth with a three-play sequence that invoked memories of Michael Vick's 2010 masterpiece at the Meadowlands
abstract: Robert Griffin III put on his cape late in the fourth with a three-play sequence that invoked memories of Michael Vick's 2010 masterpiece at the Meadowlands

headline.main: Week 7 Quick Hits: Hail to a Redskin

snippet: China figures to be a centerpiece of the third and final presidential debate, and President Obama will arrive with a newly won victory over Beijing in a trade case. A ruling last week by the World Trade Organization helps two U.S. steelmakers loca...
abstract: China figures to be a centerpiece of the third and final presidential debate, and President Obama will arrive with a newly won victory over Beijing in a trade case. A ruling last week by the World Trade Organization helps two U.S. steelmakers located in the swing states of Ohio and Pennsylvania.

headline.main: Obama Could Be Buoyed by Latest W.T.O. Victory Over China

snippet: Under the terms of the deal, BP would remain in Russia but — initially at least — only as a minority investor in an oil company controlled by the Russian government.
abstract: BP's board approves offer from Russian state oil company Rosneft to buy most of its business in Russia for cash and shares in Rosneft, further consolidating Russia’s control of its oil industry; estimates for acquisition of venture, known as TNK-BP, range from  $10 billion to $14 billion and 15 to 20 percent of Rosneft’s shares.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and STANLEY REED
